result.execSummary:
The defendant Laquis L Dawkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.    AMENDED 02-03-2017:  Court orders sentence from 01-08-2016 is hereby vacated and matter to be set for re-sentencing before another Racine County Circuit Judge.  AMENDED 05-03-2017:  Per order of the Court, the previous sentences that were ordered vacated on February 3, 2017 are hereby reinstated as sentenced on January 8, 2016.  All sentences stand as ordered on January 8, 2016.
Consecutive to: 15CF1149 and any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
No alcohol or controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Comply with Child Support orders.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: 15CF1149 and any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laquis L Dawkins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laquis L Dawkins in court with attorney Brandon Kuhl.  Defendant Laquis L Dawkins in custody.  Carolyn Hillery Delery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Matter is scheduled for an Evidentiary hearing.
The Court makes a record of the history of the case.
State calls atty G. Rosenke, DSAT.
Cross examination by Defense.
Questions by the Court.
Follow up questions by Defense.
No further questions, Witness excused.
Arguments made.
BTC: On reconsideration on the Court's decision, The court is reversing their decision for re-sentencing, The Court denies the w/drawal of the plea and denies the post conviction Motion, State to prepare an Order vacating the prior decision and granting the State's Motion to reconsider.
Evidentiary hearing on May 1, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:    No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to be monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Laquis L Dawkins in court with attorney Brandon Kuhl.  Defendant Laquis L Dawkins in custody.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jane Slaght.
State objects to breach of plea finding and requests hearing in Br. 5.  Evidentiary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on February 14, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Granting Defendant's Postconviction Motion (Court orders sentence in both matters vacated and further that both be set for re-sentencing before another Racine County Circuit Court Judge).
ORD that the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to January 17, 2017.
ORD that the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to sixty days from the date successor counsel is appointed.
MO to COA - Motion to Extend the Deadline for Filing a Postconviction Motion or Notice of Appeal
that the time to file a NOA or postconviction motion is extended to July 26, 2016.
Per RASO - defendant has been transferred to the prison system
Statement of mailing, court record listing, JOC and NIPPR mailed out.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.   No contact with victim store, La Tapatia, except for restitution purposes.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Laquis L Dawkins in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Laquis L Dawkins in custody.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
